page.title: 10PARISH PRIEST'S LIFE
page.content: Rev.Willis is the Vicar of the newest parish in Ramsgate-St.Mark's.Formerly a daughter church of St.Luke's it attained Parish status in 1983 and Rev.Willis is the second vicar.He explained that his work is very different from a priest when the Doomsday Book was compiled.He works for about 12 hours a day, 6 days a week.Each day begins with prayer and Bible study.He spends a lot of time on paperwork but part of each day is spent visiting some of his 7,000 parishioners particularly the old. Sermons have to be prepared and meetings attended.Baptisms are carried out for the young and adults providing they attend church for 3 months.As St.Mark's is a modern church only 8 weddings annually are conducted-people prefer older prettier churches.Rev. Willis likes talking to children.
